summary.p: The Addhyātma Rāmāyaṇaṃ kiḷippāṭṭŭ was composed in the 17th century by Tuñcattŭ Rāmānujan Eḻuttacchan. It is the Malayalam version of the Sanskrit Adhyātma Rāmāyaṇa, which is itself a 14th century Vedantic version of the Rāmāyaṇa. The kiḷippāṭṭŭ style, literally bird/parrot-song, refers to the bird which narrates the poem.

The text includes seven chapters:
bālakāṇḍhaṃ (2r-24v),
ayōddhyākāṇḍhaṃ (25r-66v),
āraṇyakāṇḍhaṃ (67r-99v),
kiṣkindhākāṇḍhaṃ (100r-130v),
sundarakāṇḍhaṃ (131r-151v),
yuddhakāṇḍhaṃ (152r-209v).
The manuscript is missing the first folio. Folio 2r starts from the 77th line of the bālakāṇḍhaṃ, according to the Sayahna Foundation edition (2013, 4).
The manuscript is incomplete at the end; the explicit is near the end of the yuddhakāṇḍhaṃ (2013, 444).

extent.measure: The first folio is missing, 34 verso is blank and at least 1 folio is missing at the end.

supportDesc.foliation: Malayalam numerals are in the left margin of the recto side. The folio number on the last folio is stylized and unclear.

handNote.desc: Very Neatly written. Cillakṣaraṃ are used with words and the end of the word.

decoNote.desc: An undentified emblem is on a seal at the end of the binding string, which has been cut off.

binding.p: Binding string removed, probably by the library for the purpose of digitization.

acquisition.p: Collected in CSMC from a private depositor on 13 September 2018.

encodingDesc.p: IAST Transcription. ḷ· represents a cillakṣaraṃ in the middle of a word. Word-final cillakṣaraṃ is transcribed without the mid-dot.

revisionDesc.change: Dr Giovanni Ciotti already collected some informatuion about the text and identified the folios with the chapters.
